item.title: Lacson: Gov't yet to show results for trillions in debt
item.description: Lacson said the government had yet to show results of the trillions of pesos it had borrowed over the years."Kaya mahirap tanggapin ang pahayag ng tagapagsalita ng Palasyo na maghahanap sila ng mauutangan para sa bakuna," he said.

item.title: Moderna COVID-19 vaccine shows 'no specific safety concerns' -US regulator
item.description: The US Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday issued a positively-worded briefing document about the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine ahead of a meeting by experts on whether to grant it emergency approval.

item.title: 15 nurses, including 14 who died in line of duty, named Bayaning Nars 2020
item.description: The Philippine Nurses Association has bestowed the Bayaning Nars award to 15 nurses instead of naming just one person this year.

item.title: American sex offender arrested in Cebu
item.description: The Bureau of Immigration fugitive search unit (BI-FSU) said a State of Oregon court in America released the warrant of arrest for Robert Tyler. He is also considered a high-priority target.

item.title: Cotabato City now officially part of Bangsamoro region
item.description: “Rest assured that in allowing you, our Muslim fellowmen to retake control of your destinies, the Department of Interior and Local Government (DILG) will not let you tread through this rocky and unfamiliar path alone,” Año said.

item.title: PCW urges women to be wary of sugar daddy pages
item.description: The Philippine Commission on Women on Tuesday warned Filipino women against online “sugar daddy” pages that offer financial assistance in exchange for companionship.

item.title: Senate OKs bill simplifying confirmation of imperfect land titles for farmers
item.description: Voting 17-0, the Senate on Tuesday approved on third and final reading a bill seeking to improve the confirmation of imperfect titles by simplifying the procedure and requirements in granting land deeds to farmers.

item.title: Makabayan solons slam Duterte Youth bid to revive Anti-Subversion Law as McCarthyist
item.description: ACT Teachers party-list Representative France Castro said Cardema's move only showed that her party-list acts as "the tentacles of the Duterte administration in Congress."

item.title: Dry run to give DepEd info on how to hold classes amid COVID-19
item.description: The dry run of face-to-face classes in areas with low COVID-19 risk in January 2021 will provide the Department of Education with the necessary information on how to conduct them amid the threat of the pandemic.

item.title: ALAMIN: Pagiging dehydrated, puwedeng malaman sa loob lamang ng 3 segundo
item.description: Gamit lamang ang mga kamay, maaari nang malaman sa loob ng tatlong segundo kung hydrated ba o hindi ang isang tao.

item.title: 'Somebody dropped the ball' on Pfizer COVID-19 vaccines from US, says Locsin
item.description: Ten million doses of COVID-19 vaccines made by Pfizer were supposed to be delivered to the Philippines in January but somebody committed a mistake, Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. said on Tuesday.

item.title: Duterte may sign 2021 national budget before Christmas --Palace
item.description: Malacañang on Tuesday expressed optimism that President Rodrigo Duterte will sign before Christmas the P4.506-trillion national budget for 2021.

item.title: House OKs on 3rd reading bill providing discounts to OFW remittance fees
item.description: The House of Representatives on Tuesday approved on third and final reading the measure seeking to provide discounts on the fees charged from overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) when sending remittances to their families in the Philippines.

item.title: Tokyo court sentences man to death for 2017 murders of 9 people contacted via Twitter
item.description: TOKYO - Tokyo district court on Tuesday sentenced a man to death for the 2017 murders of nine people, local media reported, ending a case that grabbed headlines in Japan with the culprit dubbed "Twitter killer" for contacting victims via the social media platform.

item.title: New coronavirus strain spreading in UK has key mutations, scientists say
item.description: LONDON - British scientists are trying to establish whether the rapid spread in southern England of a new variant of the virus that causes COVID-19 is linked to key mutations they have detected in the strain, they said on Tuesday.
